page.title: 05COMMUNITY P.C. GRAYS
page.content: THE ROLE OF A COMMUNITY POLICE OFFICER This role is taken by both men and women.It is primarily to talk to the general public,including school children,in order to build up good police/public relations.The officers concerned get to know as many people as possible in a friendly way.They still make use of police vehicles and radios,but prefer to travel on foot or by bicycle.Every school has its own officer who can be contacted when necessary,and will visit to talk to the children about road safety and personal safety.They generally work early shift and late shift but not night shift.These police officers carry radios,truncheons,warrant cards,handcuffs and pocket book,but are never armed.They are in constant contact with their local station and central control unit.
